Award.AwardTitle: SBIR Phase II: Cloud-based platform to support experiential entrepreneurship education online at scale
Award.AbstractNarration:
This SBIR Phase II project aims to provide web based software-as-a-service platform to deliver an experiential entrepreneurship methodology at scale. This two-sided platform consists of the tools for entrepreneurs to search for a repeatable and scalable business model and tools for instructors, mentors and portfolios managers to triage for early signs of failure and course correct. The project team is comprised of the chief architect, practitioners, and mentors of the highly experiential Lean Startup methodology. Collectively they possess the domain expertise to build and scale a platform for evidence-based entrepreneurship delivering the methodology and content to a global community of entrepreneurs, investors, and mentors. Phase II technology goals are to address one of the core pain points of effective mentoring by leveraging data science expertise to develop a self-learning algorithm capable of providing non-prescriptive suggestions (like an experienced mentor would ask a team) based on certain trigger events the startups would record in the platform.

The broader/commercial impact of this SBIR Phase II project is taking place at national, regional and local levels. With the success of the NSF Innovation Corps (I-Corps) program, other signification technology commercialization programs at a national level are adopting the platform to accelerate evidence-based commercialization efforts. Regional Economic Development agencies and the local Chamber of Commerce are bringing these best practices and tools to entrepreneurship ecosystems at the regional and local levels respectively. The simplicity and pragmatic nature of the offering has allowed for adoption all the way from high school students to undergraduate and graduate students in business and engineering to PhD and Post Doctorates and the Chief Innovation Officers at Fortune 500 enterprises.

POR.DRECONTENT:
NSF grant funding supported LaunchPad Central's goal of enhancing its software platform to grow beyond our initial academic software so that we could serve the needs of large enterprise clients. We accelerated the development of the beta version of our version 2.0 software (now named GLIDR) to secure this market expansion. GLIDR is designed to remove the barriers that inhibit innovation at scale, to provide management with greater visibility into projects and activities pertaining to their innovation portfolio, and to provide a database for all innovation projects, ideas, and customer discovery.

In creating GLIDR, we added regular security monitoring via third-party services and applications, prepared related documentation, increased the levels of redundancy and fault-tolerance, implemented a disaster recovery plan, and we separated processing resources between customers. GLIDR successfully responded to a security review by a major financial institution; we will use the results of this security test for future client reviews/requests. Further, in response to customer requests, we developed multiple project collaboration features and placed IP on our cloud-based platform.

The app has an online 24/7 access Help Center (utilizing Zendesk) for users to find the resources, tools, and support they need at any time during their experience, as well as a series of self-service articles (including a brief tutorial that communicates the value propositions of the platform and immediately helps to familiarize users with GLIDR's most important features, and the "Getting Started Guide") outlining how users can get the most functionality out of GLIDR. For example, we have developed content to introduce new users to lean innovation concepts and workflows and "just-in-time" onboarding and training (utlizing AppCues). These articles have helped users map and streamline their current processes to GLIDR, and have also helped our customers develop a common language across their innovation teams. The GLIDR platform provides resources to help software administrators successfully set up GLIDER for their unique use case. Administrators can evaluate and select the best way to tailor the platform to meet the necessary levels of transparency and privacy across their organization and across teams.

The ultimate outcome of the NSF grant funding is that LaunchPad Central has successfully developed its GLIDR platform. We are equipped with multi-channel customer support, self-service knowledge articles, user guides, and just-in-time resources, which provide the critical foundation we need to successfully serve our growing, global enterprise market.


Last Modified: 09/11/2017
Modified by: Patricia Malama
